data.title: Coder Nails
data.responsibility: During my time in coding bootcamp, I sported a series of coding themed nail art as social commentary on the ways the world expects software engineers to look and behave. You better believe this projects gonna be resurrected when I get that engineering $.

data.title: Dotty Dating
data.responsibility: This project started as an way to protect my friend's privacy online. Inspired by John Baldessari, I put a colorful dot on each photo in my dating profile(s), pulling a background color into focus. It was a fun branding exercise, which had to be retired as every single message I got for a while was a variation on 'What's with the dots?'.

data.title: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia
data.responsibility: The job that launched my time in the film industry. It brought me onto a tv set for the first time and showed me the joy of a group of creatives pitching in to create art together.
